page.title: 01THE AREA.
page.content: This area of the{Mendip Hills,}found either side of the Frome to Shepton Mallet road, has a population of 960 living mainly in{Doulting}and {Cranmore.}The area is fairly flat and lies between 600 and 750 feet above sea level.It is predominantly{ {farm-land }concentrating on{dairy} {farming}with the occasional arable cultivation.The area has many disused {quarries}but only one working in 1985.{Doulting Quarry}works the remaining economical area of{Doulting} {stone,}used in many local private and public buildings, together with a few nationally famous buildings further afield.Both villages are served by one by one school at{Doulting,}and each has its own village{pub.} Attractions to the area are the{East Somerset {Railway}at{Cranmore}whilst{Doulting} now has a developing{caravan site.}
